head.title: MAY OFFERS TO ACQUIRE DAVID'S BRIDAL

hedline.hl1: MAY OFFERS TO ACQUIRE DAVID'S BRIDAL

abstract.p: May Department Stores Co announces its offer to buy David's Bridal Inc for about $436 million (S)

block.p: The May Department Stores Company, whose department stores include Lord & Taylor and Filene's, said yesterday that it was offering to buy David's Bridal Inc. for $30 a share, or about $436 million. David's Bridal, based in Conshohocken, Pa., is the largest retailer of bridal gowns and related merchandise in the United States. The company, which had sales of $175 million in the 1999 fiscal year, has 110 stores. Shares of David's Bridal rose $8.1875, to $19.75, in Nasdaq trading. May's shares were up 50 cents, at $24.50. May, which has bridal registries at its department stores, agreed in April to form an e-commerce wedding site with WeddingNetwork.com.
